duties_responsibilities.duty: Perform preventative maintenance, repairs, and installations of materials to ensure proper operation and upkeep of facilities, general electric, and plumbing systems.
Perform regularly scheduled preventative maintenance on electrical and plumbing systems to ensure proper upkeep of equipment.
Perform general carpentry, painting, electrical, welding, plumbing, and HVAC installations as required.
Install and repair DC storage racks as required.
Assist with mechanical and electrical maintenance and repair of a variety of powered material handling equipment.
Maintain and complete various maintenance-related documents including work order requests, preventative maintenance, and daily job breakdown summaries.
Exhibit reasonable care and operation of powered material handling equipment.
Maintain the integrity of the Mission, Vision, and Values statement while performing daily job duties.

education_certification.credential: One to two years of maintenance-related experience required.
Strong mechanical, carpentry, plumbing, and A.C. electrical circuitry knowledge of 120V through 440, 3-phase required.
Excellent hand and eye coordination required.
Ability to interpret blueprints, schematics, and utilize basic hand tools and electrical and/or electronic test equipment including volt/ohm meters and amp probes strongly preferred.
Ability to handle multiple tasks, be detail-oriented, meet department standards, and perform duties without immediate and constant supervision.
Ability to perform physical activity at a sustained pace within the Distribution Center environment including walking, bending, and lifting is required.
Bachelor's degree in Maintenance, Engineering, or a related field (preferred)
